results.name: Table read by rows: row n gives list of lengths of runs of 1's in binary expansion of n, starting with low-order bits.
comment: A formula for A071053(n) depends on this table.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..1000 of triangle, flattened
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
example: Here are the run lengths for the numbers 0 through 21:
maple: for i from 1 to L1 do
if out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 1 then out1:=0; c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 1 then c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 0 then c:=c;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 0 then lis:=[op(lis),c]; out1:=1; c:=0;
if i = L1 and c>0 then lis:=[op(lis),c]; fi;
program: ....A245563_list.extend(len(d) for d in split('0+',bin(n)[:1:-1]) if d != '')
